description: A jnxdsRateLimitCrossed notification is generated when
the number of DHCP packets from an untrusted interface exceeds
jnxSecAccessdsIfRateLimit.

event.Summary: DHCP packets from untrusted interface exceeded the limit $v1

description: This object indicates rate limit value for DHCP Snooping purpose.
If the value of this object is 0, no rate limit is applied for DHCP
traffic at this interface.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SECURE-ACCESS-PORT-MIB::jnxSecAccessdsIfRateLimit

description: Notification is sent when the number of MAC addresses learnt by
the interface has crossed the limit of MAC addresses(jnxSecAccessIfMacLimit)
and if MAC Limit Exceeded Action(jnxSecAccessIfMacLimitExceed) is
drop or alarm or shutdown.

event.Summary: Number of MAC addresses learned by interface crossed the limit

description: This object specifies the threshold limit for the number of
MAC address entries on this interface.
When the instance value of this object is set to 0, no threshold
limit will be applied for this interfacew and the
corresponding instance value of jnxIfMacLimitExceedAction
of the same row has no effect.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SECURE-ACCESS-PORT-MIB::jnxSecAccessIfMacLimit

description: This object specifies the action to be taken by the system for this
interface while the number of MAC addresses has exceeded the value
of jnxIfMacLimit.
This object value is only effective when the corresponding instance
value of jnxIfMacLimit is not set to 0.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SECURE-ACCESS-PORT-MIB::jnxSecAccessIfMacLimitExceed

description: Notification is sent when the traffic in the interface exceeds
rising threshold(jnxStormCtlRisingThreshold).

event.Summary: Storm event: Traffic in interface exceeded rising threshold ($v1)

description: This object specifies the rising threshold value in packets
per second. The storm control action is occurs when the traffic
exceeds this threshold value.
variables.name: JUNIPER-SECURE-ACCESS-PORT-MIB::jnxStormCtlRisingThreshold
